definition: Empress Dowager Cixi or Ts'u Hsi (reigned 1861-1908)
compassionate/gentle/merciful/kind/humane
joy
Empress Dowager Cixi or Ts'u Hsi (1835-1908), regent 1861-1908

sentences.english: After eating the fine snack, Empress Dowager Cixi was fairly satisfied.
sentences.chinese: 慈禧太后吃了这精美的点心之后，很满意。

sentences.english: Cixi was sent to the Forbidden City in 1851 to be a concubine to Emperor Xianfeng.
sentences.chinese: 慈禧1851年被送进紫禁城，成为咸丰皇帝的嫔妃。

sentences.english: Cixi is Emperor Guangxu's mother. She holds the real power of the country.
sentences.chinese: 慈禧是光绪皇帝的母后，掌握着国家实权。

sentences.english: Cixi held after the death of a formal national mourning.
sentences.chinese: 慈禧死后举行了正式的国丧。

sentences.english: After the failure of innovation, thanks to its hanging empress.
sentences.chinese: 革新失败后，慈禧赐其自缢。

sentences.english: Empress Ci'An was believed to have been poisoned by Ci'Xi.
sentences.chinese: 都认为慈安是被慈禧毒死的。

sentences.english: The Empress Dowager of the Qing Dynasty attended to state affairs for several decades.
sentences.chinese: 清朝慈禧太后垂帘听政几十年。

sentences.english: The Empress Dowager was thrilled by her present.
sentences.chinese: 慈禧非常兴奋她的生日礼物。

sentences.english: The corridor links the area where Empress Dowager Cixi handled state affairs with the residential and sightseeing areas.
sentences.chinese: 长廊连接者慈禧太后处理政务和起居观光的地方。

definition: Empress Dowager Cixi or Ts'u Hsi (1835-1908), regent 1861-1908

Empress Dowager Ci'an (1837-1881) of Qing

Daoguang Emperor

An Dehai (-1869), the Qing equivalent of Rasputin, all-powerful court eunuch with the dowager empress Cixi 慈禧太后[Ci2 xi3 tai4 hou4], executed in 1869 by her rival Empress Mother Empress Dowager Ci'an 慈安皇太后
Grand Prince Yixin (1833-1898), sixth son of Emperor Daoguang, prominent politician, diplomat and modernizer in late Qing
Yuan Shikai (1859-1916), senior general of late Qing, subsequently warlord and self-proclaimed emperor of China
Grand Prince (Qing title)
Heshen (1746-1799), Manchu official of the Qing Dynasty who openly practiced various forms of corruption on a grand scale
Li Hung-chang or Li Hongzhang (1823-1901), Qing dynasty general, politician and diplomat
Ch'ing or Qing dynasty (1644-1911)
Qianlong Emperor (1711-1799), sixth Qing emperor, princely title 寶親王|宝亲王[Bao3 Qin1 wang2], personal name 弘曆|弘历[Hong2 li4], reigned 1735-1799
Fulin Emperor Shunzhi (1638-1662), second Qing emperor, reigned 1644-1662
reign name of penultimate Qing emperor Guangxu or Guang-hsu (1875-1908)
Yongzheng, reign name of Qing emperor (1722-1735)
